title: Arithmetic Operators
content: Operators are special symbols (characters) that carry out operations on operands (variables and values). For example, + is an operator that performs addition.
Here's a list of arithmetic operators in Kotlin:

title: Assignment Operators
content: Assignment operators are used to assign value to a variable.

title: Comparison and Equality Operators
content: Kotlin represents character using char. Character should be declared in a single quote like ‘c’. Please enter the following code in our coding ground and see how Kotlin interprets the character variable. Character variable cannot be declared like number variables. Kotlin variable can be declared in two ways - one using “var” and another using “val”.
code: result = (a >= b)   //greater than or equal to
result = (a <= b)   //less than or equal to

title: Logical Operators
content: There are two logical operators in Kotlin: || and &&.
Logical operators are used in control flow such as if expression, when expression, and loops.

title: in Operator
content: The in operator is used to check whether an object belongs to a collection.
